document_data.mainbody: The '''Sarkonagael''', also known as '''''Secrets of the Shadewrights''''', was a [[spellbook]] of [[shadow magic]]{{Cite digital book/Prince of Ravens/Kindle|3264|6}} likely written by the [[mage]] [[Sarkon]].<ref group="note" name="Name">No author is given for the Sarkonagael; rather, this is presumed from its shared name with the spell ''Sarkon's umbral simulacrum''.
document_data.Description: The tome was bound in black leather and had a silver skull on the cover.{{Cite digital book/Prince of Ravens/Kindle|2033|6}} Interior pages were black and had silver lettering that could only be read in pitch darkness.{{Cite digital book/Prince of Ravens/Kindle|3177|9}}

document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, the [[rogue]] [[Jack Ravenwild]] recovered the tome in an attempt to keep it out of [[Myrkyssa Jelan]]'s hands. The book disappeared from the record for over 100 years only to reappear in the {{YearlinkName|1479}} when a mysterious source offered a large reward for its return.{{Cite digital book/Prince of Ravens/Kindle||6}} Jack recovered the book from [[Sarbreen]] but cut the pages with the ''umbral simulacrum'' spell out of the book.
